channel.title: [apple fans] ios 7 discussion
channel.description:
not really sure how many people follow the development, but i just put ios 7 beta 2 on my iphone 4 because seeing videos were of it weren't good enough.
i personally think ios7 is a good comeback to compete with uprising windows 7 and android features.
still a huge fan of samsung's air features on their galaxy s, and i doubt apple will incorporate anything like it in the next iphone release but who knows?
i extremely dislike some of the app icons/ui in some areas but nothing i can't mod myself.

item.description:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:30, topic:523971”]You imply that I have a updated phone.
Mine is like, the old version of this:

Also, I know all companies do it. But at least Samsung adds new shit, like that whole wave your hand to talk, and if you look away from the screen it pauses a movie…[/quote]never once implied you had anything

the option of s4 having air gestures is the equivalent to the 4s having siri

one minor update and everyone goes crazy

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:32, topic:523971”]I heard something about iOS 7 having themes? what’s that all about?[/quote]no. the lock buttons/call ui all take colors from your background. but there are few animated backgrounds you can use.

item.title: [apple fans] ios 7 discussion
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:28, topic:523971”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=642512.msg4366028#msg4366028 date=1379707031]
Every time they release a new iPhone, it has:
A new colour,
Probably new interfaces
A new name
and…
Yeah, that’s it. $500 for a new one. LOL.
But I could be wrong, I haven’t seen iOS 7 yet.
[/quote]
This is how it works (Using iPhone 4 as an example).
They promise the “latest and greatest” in the iPhone 4.
It comes out. It’s about average.
6 months to a year later.
“Hey everyone, here’s the iPhone 4S, it has all the shit we promised you on the last model, and a new look.”
So they basically sell you shit the first time, and good quality the second time.[/quote]>implying no other company does that
cough

galaxy
galaxy s
galaxy s2
galaxy s3
galaxy s4
galaxy s4 active

etc etc

im tempted to get the 5s but i just got the 5 so im not really sure if its gonna be worth it financially.

Read full topic

item.title: [apple fans] ios 7 discussion
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:26, topic:523971”]Every time they release a new iPhone, it has:
A new colour,
Probably new interfaces
A new name
and…
Yeah, that’s it. $500 for a new one. LOL.
But I could be wrong, I haven’t seen iOS 7 yet.[/quote]
This is how it works (Using iPhone 4 as an example).
They promise the “latest and greatest” in the iPhone 4.
It comes out. It’s about average.
6 months to a year later.
“Hey everyone, here’s the iPhone 4S, it has all the shit we promised you on the last model, and a new look.”
So they basically sell you shit the first time, and good quality the second time.

Read full topic

item.title: [apple fans] ios 7 discussion
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

[quote=“gunz4life, post:14, topic:523971”][quote author=Null Amount link=topic=642512.msg4365368#msg4365368 date=1379555295]

I personally like the new icons. They look sleeker and simply better, in my opinion. There’s a few noticeable glitches that came along with it though.

What are the glitches? I’m tempted to update my ip5 to iOS 7 but I’d prefer not to if its slower than iOS 6.14, has battery issues or something along the lines of that xD
[/quote]I have noticed that the battery has been draining a lot faster, but that could just be me looking for a difference. One of the glitches that I noticed just barely was that I was making a music playlist, and when I clicked ‘Done’ to add the music in, it crashed.

Ahh, that sucks, probably gonna hold off for a while until they fix up some of these bugs then :|[/quote]

Ended up downloading iOS 7 on my older ip4 instead of my ip5 because I was quite curious about it, but didn’t wanna download it on my ip5 and get stuck with it if I didn’t like it. Honestly, I quite like the update, seems pretty cool and I’m extremely tempted to update my IP5 now to it. Ironically though, my ip4 wasn’t running extremely smoothy on iOS 6.1.3 I believe? But runs a lot more smoother on iOS 7, was a bit shocked lol.

Read full topic

item.title: [apple fans] ios 7 discussion
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:22, topic:523971”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=642512.msg4365437#msg4365437 date=1379571119][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=642512.msg4365395#msg4365395 date=1379560723]
there’s no actual battery issue. it’s just like an android. horrible battery life because so many features/animations. you can always buy a new battery, or buy the new phone.
[/quote]

I have the SGS2 and it has a longer battery life than all iPhones I know of
[/quote]my mother has the gs4 and side-by-side comparisons show little difference in the battery life for us.[/quote]

I have modified my phone quite a bit, though

Read full topic

item.title: [apple fans] ios 7 discussion
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:18, topic:523971”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=642512.msg4365395#msg4365395 date=1379560723]
there’s no actual battery issue. it’s just like an android. horrible battery life because so many features/animations. you can always buy a new battery, or buy the new phone.
[/quote]If only you had the option to turn off some of the new animations like Android (at least I don’t think there’s an option!).[/quote]only thing ive seen able to disable is the parallax effect on icons, and thats in general>accessibility>reduce motion
you can turn off background app refreshing to save some battery,

[quote=“the elve age, post:19, topic:523971”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=642512.msg4365395#msg4365395 date=1379560723]
there’s no actual battery issue. it’s just like an android. horrible battery life because so many features/animations. you can always buy a new battery, or buy the new phone.
[/quote]Animations of what?

I have the iPhone 5 and it hasn’t been letting me download the jailbreak. I’ve noticed that my battery life went to shit after the 6.1.4 update though.

EDIT: Are those iPhone 4s (plural), and did you replace the frame of them or is that a case?[/quote]if you’re referring to my video, they are both iphone fours, not four-s. and i just put colored glass on them.

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:20, topic:523971”][quote author=Null Amount link=topic=642512.msg4365398#msg4365398 date=1379561240]

there’s no actual battery issue. it’s just like an android. horrible battery life because so many features/animations. you can always buy a new battery, or buy the new phone.
[/quote]If only you had the option to turn off some of the new animations like Android (at least I don’t think there’s an option!).

There will be when it’s jailbroken (if the option isn’t available)[/quote]yes because installing a jailbreak and losing an additional 2-3 gigs is fun just to slow my phone down and turn off some animations.

[quote=“Ambokile, post:21, topic:523971”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=642512.msg4365395#msg4365395 date=1379560723]
there’s no actual battery issue. it’s just like an android. horrible battery life because so many features/animations. you can always buy a new battery, or buy the new phone.
[/quote]

I have the SGS2 and it has a longer battery life than all iPhones I know of[/quote]my mother has the gs4 and side-by-side comparisons show little difference in the battery life for us.

Read full topic
